jcr:content.jcr:title: Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Traditional

contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Soul Gospel Performance, Traditional

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Soul Gospel Performance, Traditional''' was awarded from 1978 to 1983. A similar award, the [[Grammy Award for Best Traditional Soul Gospel Album]] has been awarded since 1991. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. ==1970s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1978]] **[[James Cleveland]] for ''James Cleveland Live at Carnegie Hall'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1979]] **[[Mighty Clouds of Joy]] for ''Live and Direct'' ==1980s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1980]] **Mighty Clouds of Joy for ''Changing Times'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1981]] **James Cleveland & the [[Charles Fold Singers]] for ''Lord, Let Me Be an Instrument'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1982]] **[[Al Green]] for ''The Lord Will Make a Way'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1983]] **Al Green for ''Precious Lord'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Grammy Award For Best Soul Gospel Performance, Traditional}} [[Category:Grammy Awards for gospel music]]
